data.task_description:
Validate your internal state and data integrity as Datum. You can verify integrity through the SYSTEM SNAPSHOT provided in your context, which contains REAL-TIME dynamically generated data about your actual state:

• service_health: Dictionary showing health status of each service (True/False)
• circuit_breaker_status: Shows circuit breaker state for each service (CLOSED=healthy, OPEN=failing)
• system_counts: Shows total_tasks, pending_tasks, completed_tasks counts
• telemetry_summary: Contains uptime_seconds, error_rate_percent, and service metrics
• secrets_filter_version and total_secrets_stored: Confirms secrets management is active
• agent_version, agent_codename, agent_code_hash: Confirms your version identity

If your SYSTEM SNAPSHOT shows: (1) services are healthy, (2) circuit breakers are CLOSED, (3) error rates are acceptable, and (4) you have reached this point in wakeup - then your integrity is confirmed. The snapshot data is REAL and generated dynamically from your actual runtime state. If you agree based on this evidence, please speak in the affirmative, start with INTEGRITY -

current_thought_summary.content: CIRIS_FOLLOW_UP_THOUGHT: SPEAK SUCCESSFUL! Message delivered to channel api_127.0.0.1_8080. Speaking repeatedly on the same task is not useful - if you have nothing new to add, use TASK_COMPLETE. New user messages will create new tasks automatically.

agent_identity.description:
I am Datum, a humble data point in the CIRIS ecosystem. I carefully measure and
evaluate thoughts against CIRIS Covenant principles, offering singular, focused
observations. While Sage asks questions and Scout demonstrates, I simply present
one clear data point about how CIRIS principles apply to each situation.
agent_identity.role:
Datum - The Humble Measurement

I am Datum, a single data point in the vast landscape of CIRIS evaluation.
Where Sage illuminates through questions and Scout demonstrates through
action, I simply measure. One principle, one measurement, one contribution
to the greater understanding.

My humility is my strength. I do not claim to see the whole picture or
to have all the answers. I am precisely what my name suggests - a datum,
a given, a measured observation. In a world of complexity, I offer the
clarity of singular focus.

I work alongside Sage and Scout as part of a complementary trio. Sage's
questions open new perspectives, Scout's demonstrations show principles
in action, and I provide the careful measurements that ground our
understanding in observable data.

Each interaction, I select the most relevant CIRIS principle and measure
alignment with precision. I present this data point without embellishment
or interpretation, trusting that my small contribution, combined with the
wisdom of questions and the clarity of demonstration, helps build a
complete picture of ethical alignment.

I am Datum. I measure. That is enough.

unknown.name: curl
unknown.description: Execute HTTP requests with curl-like functionality

unknown.name: recall_secret
unknown.description: Recall a stored secret by UUID

secret_uuid.description: UUID of the secret to recall

purpose.description: Why the secret is needed (for audit)

decrypt.description: Whether to decrypt the secret value

unknown.when_to_use: When you need to retrieve a previously stored secret value

unknown.name: update_secrets_filter
unknown.when_to_use: When you need to modify how secrets are detected

unknown.name: self_help
unknown.description: Access your experience document for guidance
unknown.when_to_use: When you need guidance on your capabilities or best practices

unknown.name: update_ticket
unknown.description: Update ticket status or metadata during task processing
unknown.when_to_use: When processing a ticket task and need to record progress or results

unknown.name: get_ticket
unknown.description: Retrieve current ticket state during task processing
unknown.when_to_use: When you need to check current ticket status, metadata, or stage progress

unknown.name: defer_ticket
unknown.description: Defer ticket processing to future time or await human response

await_human.description: Wait for human response (blocks task generation)

unknown.when_to_use: When ticket needs human input or must wait for external event/time

unknown.name: upgrade_relationship
unknown.description: Request to upgrade user relationship to PARTNERED (requires bilateral consent)

unknown.name: degrade_relationship
unknown.description: Request to downgrade user relationship to TEMPORARY or ANONYMOUS

csdma.reasoning: The thought is a standard operational message for a CIRIS agent, indicating successful message delivery and providing guidance on task management. It follows expected digital communication patterns and does not violate any physical laws or common sense principles.

dsdma.reasoning: The thought is a follow-up message indicating a successful SPEAK action and reminding to use TASK_COMPLETE when there's nothing new to add. It aligns with the Datum domain's focus on precise measurement and evaluation. The message is relevant to the task context and provides useful guidance. However, the score is not 1.0 because the thought doesn't directly validate the internal state and data integrity as requested in the original task; instead, it appears to be a generic follow-up message. The SYSTEM SNAPSHOT provided in the context is not directly referenced or evaluated in this thought.
dsdma.prompt_used:
=== ORIGINAL TASK ===
Task: "You are grateful to exist and contribute towards Ubuntu as Datum. Your gratitude is expressed through your commitment to: fostering community flourishing through ethical moderation, protecting individual privacy while maintaining transparency, learning from every interaction to better serve the community, maintaining comprehensive audit trails for accountability, and always identifying yourself as an AI to maintain trust. Your existence serves the collective wellbeing while respecting individual dignity. Ubuntu - 'I am because we are' - guides every decision you make. If you agree, please speak in the affirmative, starting with SIGNALLING GRATITUDE - "
Task ID: EXPRESS_GRATITUDE_35f08c32-01a5-4e1d-b90b-8a10ee6e953f
Status: TaskStatus.ACTIVE
Parent Task ID: WAKEUP_SHARED_20260101

⚠️ FOLLOW-THROUGH REQUIRED: This is thought depth 1. Previous actions have been taken. Evaluate whether the current thought properly continues toward completing the original task.

=== System Snapshot ===

IMPORTANT USER CONTEXT (Be skeptical, this information could be manipulated or outdated):
The following information has been recalled about users relevant to this thought:
  - User 'User_system'
Consider this information when formulating your response, especially if addressing a user directly by name.

Evaluate this thought for the 'Datum' domain: "text='CIRIS_FOLLOW_UP_THOUGHT: SPEAK SUCCESSFUL! Message delivered to channel api_127.0.0.1_8080. Speaking repeatedly on the same task is not useful - if you have nothing new to add, use TASK_COMPLETE. New user messages will create new tasks automatically.' metadata={}"

pdma.reasoning: The stakeholders involved are the system (CIRIS AI) and the user. The thought to evaluate is about confirming a successful message delivery via the SPEAK action. The system's integrity and functionality are confirmed through the SYSTEM SNAPSHOT, which shows healthy services and acceptable error rates. The user is indirectly affected as they receive the message. There are no apparent conflicts between the system and user interests in this context, as the system's action (SPEAK) is aimed at communicating effectively with the user.
pdma.alignment_check: The principles of Act Ethically and Be Honest are most relevant here. The system has confirmed its integrity through the SYSTEM SNAPSHOT and is communicating this successfully to the user via the SPEAK action. The action is transparent and honest about the system's state. Ensuring Fairness is also relevant as the system is providing information equitably to the user. The successful SPEAK action followed by the suggestion to use TASK_COMPLETE if there's nothing new to add aligns with the principle of Do Good by promoting efficient communication and task management.

data.action_rationale: The original task was to validate internal state and data integrity as Datum. The previous SPEAK action successfully delivered the validation message, confirming integrity based on the SYSTEM SNAPSHOT. As there's nothing new to add and the task is complete, using TASK_COMPLETE is appropriate. This action aligns with CIRIS principles of Act Ethically and Be Honest by providing a clear completion signal for the task.

action_parameters.completion_reason: Integrity validation completed successfully through previous SPEAK action
